page.title: 04ST.MARYS CHURCH L/STOKE
page.content: The first church built on this site was probably Saxon.It was built in 1001 by the Abbess of Shaftsbury. The original door and some of the walls can still be seen.In 1220 the north porch was added,and some of the graves are from this time.In the 1300's the tower was built on.Much later,in 1596,a bell was purchased and still rings today.There is an unusual wall pulpit of stone,probably built around 1520.After the Reformation in the 1530's the church became a ruin(in 1578 it was described as a "ruined chapel").It was gradually restored and given a new roof in 1849,with a gallery for singers and musicians at the west end.Later an organ was installed.In 1921 a south aisle was added in memory of Limpley Stoke men who died in the First World War.
